intro: Metrosideros polymorpha, commonly known as the Hawaiian Christmas bush, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy red or orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal and upland habitats. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The species plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian ecosystems, providing food and habitat for native wildlife.
